pages.text: $(n)Requirements for most plant-based Farms$(): $(li)Transform $(item)Dirt$() with a $(item)Hoe$() to $(item)Farmland.$() $(br)$(li)$(item)Farmland$() needs a $(item)Water$() source up to 4 blocks away. $(br)$(li)Light is required. $(br)$(li)Many farms require their chunks to be ticked that the state of growth changes. That means a $(thing)Player$() must be nearby (within 128 blocks), or you use a $(item)Chunk Loader$() from a $(thing)Mod$().

pages.title: Manual Food Farms
pages.text: The first farm you should always be a simple, classic $(item)Wheat$() or $(item)Vegetable$() farm.

pages.title: Semi-auto Wheat Farm
pages.text: That's still a simple $(n)semi-auto$() $(item)Wheat$() farm. $(br2)(The glass is to illustrate the construction) $(br)$(li)Flipping the $(item)Lever$() causes the $(item)Pistons$() to lower, allowing $(item)Water$() to flow down over the fields and flushing the drops into a $(item)Hopper$() to a $(item)Chest$().
This farm can be expanded infinitely downwards.

pages.title: Auto Chicken Farm
pages.text: This farm will give you $(item)Cooked Chicken$() and $(item)Feathers$() automatically when fully loaded. $(br)$(li)The $(item)Gold Blocks$() must be solid blocks to properly conduct $(item)Redstone$() signal.

pages.title: Auto Melon/Pumpkin Farm
pages.text: This farm will harvest $(item)Melons$() or $(item)Pumpkins$() automatically for you.
This farm can be expanded sideways.

pages.title: Semi-auto Pig/Cow Farm
pages.text: Animals such as $(thing)Pigs$() and $(thing)Cows$() can be farmed here. $(br2)Some adults have to be caged above and paired so that the babies fall down and are grilled when they grow up.
